auth.revoke.name: test
auth.revoke.description: Setting this parameter to 1 triggers a testing mode where the specified token will not actually be revoked.

bots.info.name: bot
bots.info.description: Bot user to get info on

channels.create.name: validate
channels.create.description: Whether to return errors on invalid channel name instead of modifying it to meet the specified criteria.

channels.history.name: latest
channels.history.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.

channels.history.name: oldest
channels.history.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.

channels.history.name: inclusive
channels.history.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results.

channels.history.name: count
channels.history.description: Number of messages to return, between 1 and 1000.

channels.join.name: validate
channels.join.description: Whether to return errors on invalid channel name instead of modifying it to meet the specified criteria.

channels.list.name: exclude_archived
channels.list.description: Exclude archived channels from the list

channels.list.name: exclude_members
channels.list.description: Exclude the members collection from each channel

channels.mark.name: channel
channels.mark.description: Channel to set reading cursor in.

channels.mark.name: ts
channels.mark.description: Timestamp of the most recently seen message.

channels.rename.name: validate
channels.rename.description: Whether to return errors on invalid channel name instead of modifying it to meet the specified criteria.

channels.replies.name: thread_ts
channels.replies.description: Unique identifier of a thread's parent message

channels.setPurpose.name: channel
channels.setPurpose.description: Channel to set the purpose of

channels.setTopic.name: channel
channels.setTopic.description: Channel to set the topic of

chat.delete.name: token
chat.delete.description:
Authentication token.
Requires scope: chat:write:bot or chat:write:user

chat.delete.name: ts
chat.delete.description: Timestamp of the message to be deleted.

chat.delete.name: channel
chat.delete.description: Channel containing the message to be deleted.

chat.delete.name: as_user
chat.delete.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user. Bot users in this context are considered authed users.

chat.meMessage.name: channel
chat.meMessage.description: Channel to send message to. Can be a public channel, private group or IM channel. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

chat.meMessage.name: text
chat.meMessage.description: Text of the message to send.

chat.postMessage.name: token
chat.postMessage.description:
Authentication token.
Requires scope: chat:write:bot or chat:write:user

chat.postMessage.name: channel
chat.postMessage.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See below for more details.

chat.postMessage.name: text
chat.postMessage.description: Text of the message to send. See below for an explanation of formatting. This field is usually required, unless you're providing only attachments instead.

chat.postMessage.name: parse
chat.postMessage.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to none. See below.

chat.postMessage.name: link_names
chat.postMessage.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

chat.postMessage.name: unfurl_links
chat.postMessage.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

chat.postMessage.name: unfurl_media
chat.postMessage.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

chat.postMessage.name: username
chat.postMessage.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

chat.postMessage.name: as_user
chat.postMessage.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See authorship below.

chat.postMessage.name: icon_url
chat.postMessage.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

chat.postMessage.name: icon_emoji
chat.postMessage.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

chat.postMessage.name: thread_ts
chat.postMessage.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

chat.postMessage.name: reply_broadcast
chat.postMessage.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

chat.unfurl.name: ts
chat.unfurl.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to

chat.unfurl.name: unfurls
chat.unfurl.description: JSON mapping a set of URLs from the message to their unfurl attachments

chat.unfurl.name: user_auth_required
chat.unfurl.description: Set to true or 1 to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain

chat.update.name: token
chat.update.description:
Authentication token.
Requires scope: chat:write:bot or chat:write:user

chat.update.name: ts
chat.update.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

chat.update.name: channel
chat.update.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

chat.update.name: text
chat.update.description: New text for the message, using the default formatting rules.

chat.update.name: parse
chat.update.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to client, unlike chat.postMessage. See below.

chat.update.name: link_names
chat.update.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to none. This parameter should be used in conjunction with parse. To set link_names to 1, specify a parse mode of full.

chat.update.name: as_user
chat.update.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. Bot users in this context are considered authed users.

dnd.info.name: user
dnd.info.description: User to fetch status for (defaults to current user)

dnd.setSnooze.name: num_minutes
dnd.setSnooze.description: Number of minutes, from now, to snooze until.

dnd.teamInfo.name: users
dnd.teamInfo.description: Comma-separated list of users to fetch Do Not Disturb status for

files.comments.add.name: file
files.comments.add.description: File to add a comment to.

files.comments.add.name: comment
files.comments.add.example: Everyone should take a moment to read this file.
files.comments.add.description: Text of the comment to add.

files.comments.delete.name: file
files.comments.delete.description: File to delete a comment from.

files.comments.edit.name: file
files.comments.edit.description: File containing the comment to edit.

files.comments.edit.name: comment
files.comments.edit.example: Everyone should take a moment to read this file, seriously.
files.comments.edit.description: Text of the comment to edit.

files.info.name: file
files.info.description: Specify a file by providing its ID.

files.info.name: count
files.info.description: Number of items to return per page.

files.info.name: page
files.info.description: Page number of results to return.

files.list.name: user
files.list.description: Filter files created by a single user.

files.list.name: channel
files.list.description: Filter files appearing in a specific channel, indicated by its ID.

files.list.name: ts_from
files.list.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive).

files.list.name: ts_to
files.list.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive).

files.list.name: types
files.list.description:
Filter files by type:


all - All files
spaces - Posts
snippets - Snippets
images - Image files
gdocs - Google docs
zips - Zip files
pdfs - PDF files


You can pass multiple values in the types argument, like types=spaces,snippets.The default value is all, which does not filter the list.

files.list.name: count
files.list.description: Number of items to return per page.

files.list.name: page
files.list.description: Page number of results to return.

files.upload.name: file
files.upload.description: File contents via multipart/form-data. If omitting this parameter, you must submit content.

files.upload.name: content
files.upload.description: File contents via a POST variable. If omitting this parameter, you must provide a file.

files.upload.name: initial_comment
files.upload.description: Initial comment to add to file.

files.upload.name: channels
files.upload.description: Comma-separated list of channel names or IDs where the file will be shared.

groups.create.name: name
groups.create.description: Name of private channel to create

groups.create.name: validate

im.history.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.

im.history.name: inclusive

im.history.name: count

im.replies.description: Direct message channel to fetch thread from

mpim.history.name: latest
mpim.history.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.

mpim.history.name: oldest
mpim.history.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.

mpim.history.name: inclusive
mpim.history.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results.

mpim.history.name: count
mpim.history.description: Number of messages to return, between 1 and 1000.

mpim.mark.name: channel
mpim.mark.description: multiparty direct message channel to set reading cursor in.

mpim.mark.name: ts

mpim.open.name: users
mpim.open.description: Comma separated lists of users.  The ordering of the users is preserved whenever a MPIM group is returned.

mpim.replies.name: channel
mpim.replies.description: Multiparty direct message channel to fetch thread from.

mpim.replies.name: thread_ts
mpim.replies.description: Unique identifier of a thread's parent message.

oauth.access.name: client_id
oauth.access.description: Issued when you created your application.

oauth.access.name: client_secret
oauth.access.description: Issued when you created your application.

oauth.access.name: code
oauth.access.description: The code param returned via the OAuth callback.

oauth.access.name: redirect_uri
oauth.access.description: This must match the originally submitted URI (if one was sent).

pins.add.name: channel
pins.add.description: Channel to pin the item in.

pins.add.name: timestamp
pins.add.description: Timestamp of the message to pin.

pins.list.name: channel
pins.list.description: Channel to get pinned items for.

pins.remove.name: channel
pins.remove.description: Channel where the item is pinned to.

pins.remove.name: timestamp
pins.remove.description: Timestamp of the message to un-pin.

reactions.add.name: file_comment
reactions.add.description: File comment to add reaction to.

reactions.add.name: channel
reactions.add.description: Channel where the message to add reaction to was posted.

reactions.add.name: timestamp
reactions.add.description: Timestamp of the message to add reaction to.

reactions.get.name: file_comment
reactions.get.description: File comment to get reactions for.

reactions.get.name: channel
reactions.get.description: Channel where the message to get reactions for was posted.

reactions.get.name: timestamp
reactions.get.description: Timestamp of the message to get reactions for.

reactions.get.name: full
reactions.get.description: If true always return the complete reaction list.

reactions.list.name: user
reactions.list.description: Show reactions made by this user. Defaults to the authed user.

reactions.list.name: full
reactions.list.description: If true always return the complete reaction list.

reactions.list.name: count
reactions.list.description: Number of items to return per page.

reactions.list.name: page
reactions.list.description: Page number of results to return.

reactions.remove.name: file_comment
reactions.remove.description: File comment to remove reaction from.

reactions.remove.name: channel
reactions.remove.description: Channel where the message to remove reaction from was posted.

reactions.remove.name: timestamp
reactions.remove.description: Timestamp of the message to remove reaction from.

reminders.add.name: time
reminders.add.description: When this reminder should happen: the Unix timestamp (up to five years from now), the number of seconds until the reminder (if within 24 hours), or a natural language description (Ex. "in 15 minutes," or "every Thursday")

reminders.add.name: user
reminders.add.description: The user who will receive the reminder. If no user is specified, the reminder will go to user who created it.

reminders.complete.name: reminder
reminders.complete.description: The ID of the reminder to be marked as complete

rtm.connect.name: token
rtm.connect.description:
Authentication token.
Requires token type: session or oauth or bot or app
Requires scope: client

rtm.start.name: simple_latest
rtm.start.description: Return timestamp only for latest message object of each channel (improves performance).

rtm.start.name: no_unreads
rtm.start.description: Skip unread counts for each channel (improves performance).

rtm.start.name: mpim_aware
rtm.start.description: Returns MPIMs to the client in the API response.

rtm.start.name: no_latest
rtm.start.description: Exclude latest timestamps for channels, groups, mpims, and ims. Automatically sets no_unreads to 1

search.all.name: query
search.all.description: Search query. May contains booleans, etc.

search.all.name: sort
search.all.description: Return matches sorted by either score or timestamp.

search.all.name: sort_dir
search.all.description: Change sort direction to ascending (asc) or descending (desc).

search.all.name: highlight
search.all.description: Pass a value of true to enable query highlight markers (see below).

search.all.name: count
search.all.description: Number of items to return per page.

search.all.name: page
search.all.description: Page number of results to return.

search.files.description: Search query. May contain booleans, etc.

search.files.name: count

search.files.name: page

search.messages.name: query

search.messages.name: sort

search.messages.name: sort_dir

search.messages.name: count

search.messages.name: page
search.messages.description: Page number of results to return.

stars.add.name: file_comment
stars.add.description: File comment to add star to.

stars.add.name: channel
stars.add.description: Channel to add star to, or channel where the message to add star to was posted (used with timestamp).

stars.add.name: timestamp
stars.add.description: Timestamp of the message to add star to.

stars.list.name: count
stars.list.description: Number of items to return per page.

stars.list.name: page
stars.list.description: Page number of results to return.

stars.remove.name: file_comment
stars.remove.description: File comment to remove star from.

stars.remove.name: channel
stars.remove.description: Channel to remove star from, or channel where the message to remove star from was posted (used with timestamp).

stars.remove.name: timestamp
stars.remove.description: Timestamp of the message to remove star from.

team.accessLogs.name: count
team.accessLogs.description: Number of items to return per page.

team.accessLogs.name: page
team.accessLogs.description: Page number of results to return.

team.accessLogs.name: before
team.accessLogs.description: End of time range of logs to include in results (inclusive).

team.billableInfo.name: user
team.billableInfo.description: A user to retrieve the billable information for. Defaults to all users.

team.integrationLogs.name: service_id
team.integrationLogs.description: Filter logs to this service. Defaults to all logs.

team.integrationLogs.name: app_id
team.integrationLogs.description: Filter logs to this Slack app. Defaults to all logs.

team.integrationLogs.name: user
team.integrationLogs.description: Filter logs generated by this userâs actions. Defaults to all logs.

team.integrationLogs.name: change_type
team.integrationLogs.description: Filter logs with this change type. Defaults to all logs.

team.integrationLogs.name: count
team.integrationLogs.description: Number of items to return per page.

team.integrationLogs.name: page
team.integrationLogs.description: Page number of results to return.

usergroups.create.name: name
usergroups.create.description: A name for the User Group. Must be unique among User Groups.

usergroups.create.name: handle
usergroups.create.description: A mention handle. Must be unique among channels, users and User Groups.

usergroups.create.name: description
usergroups.create.description: A short description of the User Group.

usergroups.create.name: channels
usergroups.create.description: A comma separated string of encoded channel IDs for which the User Group uses as a default.

usergroups.create.name: include_count
usergroups.create.description: Include the number of users in each User Group.

usergroups.disable.name: usergroup
usergroups.disable.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to disable.

usergroups.disable.name: include_count
usergroups.disable.description: Include the number of users in the User Group.

usergroups.enable.name: usergroup
usergroups.enable.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to enable.

usergroups.enable.name: include_count
usergroups.enable.description: Include the number of users in the User Group.

usergroups.list.name: include_count
usergroups.list.description: Include the number of users in each User Group.

usergroups.list.name: include_users
usergroups.list.description: Include the list of users for each User Group.

usergroups.update.name: usergroup
usergroups.update.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to update.

usergroups.update.name: name
usergroups.update.description: A name for the User Group. Must be unique among User Groups.

usergroups.update.name: handle
usergroups.update.description: A mention handle. Must be unique among channels, users and User Groups.

usergroups.update.name: description
usergroups.update.description: A short description of the User Group.

usergroups.update.name: channels
usergroups.update.description: A comma separated string of encoded channel IDs for which the User Group uses as a default.

usergroups.update.name: include_count
usergroups.update.description: Include the number of users in the User Group.

usergroups.users.list.name: usergroup
usergroups.users.list.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to update.

usergroups.users.list.name: include_disabled
usergroups.users.list.description: Allow results that involve disabled User Groups.

usergroups.users.update.name: usergroup
usergroups.users.update.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to update.

usergroups.users.update.name: users
usergroups.users.update.description: A comma separated string of encoded user IDs that represent the entire list of users for the User Group.

usergroups.users.update.name: include_count
usergroups.users.update.description: Include the number of users in the User Group.

users.getPresence.name: user
users.getPresence.description: User to get presence info on. Defaults to the authed user.

users.list.name: presence
users.list.description: Whether to include presence data in the output

users.setPhoto.name: crop_x
users.setPhoto.description: X coordinate of top-left corner of crop box

users.setPhoto.name: crop_y
users.setPhoto.description: Y coordinate of top-left corner of crop box

users.profile.get.name: user
users.profile.get.description: User to retrieve profile info for

users.profile.get.name: include_labels
users.profile.get.description: Include labels for each ID in custom profile fields

users.profile.set.name: user
users.profile.set.description: ID of user to change. This argument may only be specified by team admins on paid teams.

users.profile.set.name: profile
users.profile.set.description: Collection of key:value pairs presented as a URL-encoded JSON hash.

users.profile.set.name: name
users.profile.set.description: Name of a single key to set. Usable only if profile is not passed.

users.profile.set.name: value
users.profile.set.description: Value to set a single key to. Usable only if profile is not passed.
